DOC.brief_summary: The goal research study demonstrate Cardiac Perfusion MRI Vasomotor Stress may serve non-invasive less risky imaging technique detect non-obstructive perfusion deficit and/or abnormality myocardial blood flow ( MBF ) patient endothelial dysfunction . This control study , enroll approximately 60 subject ( 30 diabetic 30 non-diabetics serve healthy control ) , include male non-pregnant female , age 18-50 year . All eligible participant sign inform consent complete Lifestyle Questionnaire . They undergo blood work include : - 2-hour Oral Glucose Tolerance Test Fasting Labs Glucose , Insulin , C-Peptide , HbA1c , Creatinine , Lipid Panel . - Urine Albumin Creatinine ratio microalbuminuria . - Serum inflammatory marker : E-selectin , homocysteine , ADMA , VCAM , IL-6 , TNFalpha , hs-CRP PAI-1 . After blood work , participant undergo cardiac MR perfusion image procedure Cold Pressor Test Adenosine Stress Test .
DOC.brief_title: Cardiac Magnetic Resonance Imaging Detecting Endothelial Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Age 18 50 year Should able sign inform consent HIPAA Agreement 30 healthy , nondiabetic individual 30 diabetic individual without document coronary artery disease Diagnosed diabetic less 5 year HbA1c less 8.0 Children 18 year adults 50 year Type 1 DM Lactating Pregnant females BMI le 35 Contraindication MRI pacemaker , defibrillator implant , etc . Allergy MR ( paramagnetic ) contrast History Angina , MI , document Coronary Artery Disease Previous history CHF , CABG , Angioplasty Stenting History Valvular Heart Disease Congenital Heart Disease History Peripheral Vascular Disease History Cardiac Arrythmias anticoagulation therapy History Cerebrovascular accident TIA History active diabetic retinopathy nephropathy Uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic > 170 diastolic > 100 mm Hg End Stage Renal Disease patient dialysis HbA1c 8.0 Creatinine great 1.7 mg/dl History active gastrointestinal bleeding History IV drug use Chronic current steroid treatment Growth hormone treatment
